definition[0]: to find out if something is true or to check that something has been done
example[0]: ‘Did you lock the front door?’ ‘I think so, but I’d better make sure.’
example[1]: I wanted to make sure you were all right.
example[2]: First, make sure the printer has enough paper in it.
definition[1]: to do something so that you can be certain of the result
example[3]: I’ll walk you home, just to make sure no one bothers you.
example[4]: Spain made sure of their place by holding Japan to a 1–1 draw.
example[5]: Thomas would be sorry – she would make sure of that.
